description: Ms. codex. Title from lower edge of the text block. 13 lines per page. Written in clear medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Dark thick paper with pulp and chain lines visible. Important marginalia, with ḥāshiyah and short excerpts of other works. These continue after the end of the text on fol. 285b-286b (including a ṣalāt al-Ḥājah on fol. 285b). Fol i is a later addition on glazed european paper, with a grid in red ink on the verso. Kabīkaj, verses of poetry in Persian, inscriptions and short texts on fol. 1a. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Uṣūl 3" (repeated in pink pencil on the pastedown of the upper cover). Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 199". Incipit: الحمد لله خالق النسم ورازق القسم مبدع البدايع وشارع الشرايع ... قال الشيخ الامام ... على بن محمد البزدوى ... العلم نوعان علم التوحيد والصفات وعلم الشرايع والاحكام Explicit: وذلك مثل تناول محظور الاحرام عن ضروره بالمحرم انّه ترخص له وتضمن الجزآء فكذلك ههنا والله تع اعلم بالصواب والله المرجع والمآب
author: Bazdawī, ʻAlī ibn Muḥammad, 1009 or 1010-1089 or 1090
extent: i, 286, i leaves: paper ; 193 x 165 (100 x 93) mm. bound to 200 x 175 mm.
title: Kitāb Uṣūl Bazdawī.
provenance: From the books of Aḥmad Najīb ibn Aḥmad Ṭāhir (ownership statement on fol. 1a). Seal on fol. 286a. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: بزدوي، علي بن محمد
subject: Islamic law—Interpretation and construction—Early works to 1800
binding note: Upper and lower covers blind stamped with a panel with floral motifs. Spine with four sewing stations, with gilt working. The title is imprinted in gold on the spine. Pink paper pastedown and free endpaper.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
